name: 2-Consumer to DTR Mapping Methodologies
content:
Consumer to DTR Mapping Methodologies


To map each consumer meter to the most probable DTR, we used a combination of event-driven and correlation-based techniques:


‚úÖ A. Zero Consumption Matching

  • Identify timestamps where both the consumer and candidate DTRs had zero energy usage.
  • Score DTRs based on the number of matching zero-consumption hours.


‚úÖ B. Power Event Matching (Hourly)

  • Detect distinct power OFF/ON events in consumer and DTR data.
  • Normalize events at an hourly level.
  • Calculate overlap percentage and score DTRs accordingly.


‚úÖ C. Voltage-Based Correlation

  • Use consumer voltage trend vs DTR phase voltages (L1, L2, L3).
  • Apply Spearman/Pearson correlation over a week or month.
  • Select DTR with highest correlation as the best match.


‚úÖ D. Power-On Duration from Billing Data (Experimental)

  • Extract active hours from billing data.
  • Compare with DTR uptime durations.
  • Dropped due to low uniqueness in high-density areas.


üîç Final Mapping Output

  • Consumers were classified under:
  • Single Match (High Confidence)
  • Multiple Matches (Close Scores)
  • Unresolved (Ambiguous Duration or No Event Overlap)
